title: Paramount's Super Bowl Boost And Studio Strength Help Offset Streaming Miss: Analyst
summary: Goldman Sachs analyst Michael Ng maintained a Not Rated stance on Paramount Global (PARA), which reported revenue of $7.19 billion and adjusted OIBDA of $688 million, both exceeding estimates. Despite flat TV Media advertising and a slight decline in DTC advertising due to AVOD competition, Paramount+ subscribers rose to 79 million. The company anticipates closing the Skydance acquisition in early 2025 and reported free cash flow of $123 million, surpassing expectations. However, DTC revenue of $2.04 billion fell short. Guidance for the second quarter suggests a decline in Paramount+ subscribers, but ARPU growth is expected by Q1 2025. Analysts project fiscal 2025 revenue of $28.7 billion and adjusted EPS of $0.81, with PARA's stock currently up 0.50% to $12.00.

title: Unity Software's Options: A Look at What the Big Money is Thinking
summary: High-profile investors are adopting a bearish outlook on Unity Software (U), as indicated by unusual options trading activity, with 61% of trades being bearish. title: Why Shopify  ( SHOP )  Stock Hit A New 52-Week High Today - Shopify  ( NASDAQ:SHOP )
summary: Shopify Inc. shares rose 14.8% to $105.26 after being announced as a new member of the Nasdaq-100, replacing MongoDB. The company reported a 26.8% revenue increase to $2.36 billion in Q1, although adjusted EPS of 25 cents fell short of expectations. Analysts highlighted strong growth in merchant activity and consumer demand, bolstered by improved sentiment from a U.S.-China tariff reduction agreement. With minimal exposure to Chinese imports, Shopify is expected to continue growing, with projected Q2 revenue of around $2.56 billion and EPS of 30 cents. As of the latest update, shares are trading at $104.42, and investors can purchase them through brokerage accounts.
